data.title: [VSCode Alpha] Freeze on startup
data.body:
- VSCode Version:0.10.12-alpha 32bd7fd3
- OS Version:Win7

The latest version of VSCode alpha freezes during startup when running the extension Gerrit. The reason that I am reporting this here is that the same version of Gerrit (v0.2.1) runs correctly on v0.10.11

I am only able to get the freeze to occur on a specific Git repository, and if I step through the code in debug mode it doesn't freeze. I believe it has something to do with handling of rejected promises.

I will continue to debug the extension, I just posted this here incase a regression had occurred in the way you launch extensions or handle errors within them,.

data.title: [Setup] Unable to Update Insiders
data.body:
- **VSCode Version**:
  Visual Studio Code - Insiders
  Version 0.10.10-insider
  Commit 5b5f4db87c10345b9d5c8d0bed745bcad4533135
  Date 2016-03-07T10:19:42.065Z
  Shell 0.35.6
  Renderer 45.0.2454.85
  Node 4.1.1
- **OS Version**: Windows 7

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Verify there are no instances of VSCode running via Process Explorer
2. Run VSCode Insiders
3. Either wait for it to automatically notify about new version or manually check
4. Select "Update Now" and VSCode closes and the installer starts
5. During the install I get the following message:

```
Error
Setup was unable to automatically close all applications. It is recommended that you close all applications using files that need to be updated by Setup before continuing.

Click Retry to try again, Ignore to proceed anyway, or Abort to cancel installation.
Abort   Retry   Ignore  
```

None of the buttons will allow the install to continue. I checked Process Explorer and there are no instances of VSCode running. The only processes are:
- CodeSetup-18ebb4a4f5491af7b16e91e42fc36410bbb2e4d7.exe at C:\Users<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\vscode-update\CodeSetup-18ebb4a4f5491af7b16e91e42fc36410bbb2e4d7.exe
  with a child process:
- CodeSetup-18ebb4a4f5491af7b16e91e42fc36410bbb2e4d7.tmp at C:\Users<user>\AppData\Local\Temp\is-S78QT.tmp\CodeSetup-18ebb4a4f5491af7b16e91e42fc36410bbb2e4d7.tmp

This happened during the last Insiders update and the only way I was able to update was to uninstall and install the updated setup.

Any ideas on what's going on?

Thanks,
Derek

data.title: Output Window is removing new lines
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Printing any line that only contains a new line to the output window.

This might be by design. But it would be much appreciated, if the output window didn't ignore lines only containing new lines. Personally I like to split out outputted chunks for text with new lines for ease of readability.

It also looks like the output window is printing per line-break, as the "extra" new line in `"Test\n\nTest\n"` still isn't printed.

My current _workaround_ is adding a single space before the new line. Though this adds complication.

data.title: Go To Next Error does not go to next error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:

When I press F8 I can navigate to the next error in the current file. But when I remove all errors in a current file and I press F8 it does not navigate to the error in the next erroneous file. Is this a bug or a feature? Thanks

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 / NVDA screen reader

Steps to Reproduce:
1. enable NVDA
2. open TS file
3. open code complete
4. Press Alt+Cursor+Down to navigate to next entry

Observe: screen reader reads entry two times (at least that is what I see in the Speech Viewer)

data.title: Screen reader: loosing cursor in Suggest widget
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10 / NVDA screen reader

Steps to Reproduce:
1. enable NVDA screen reader
2. open a TS file
3. open code complete for something were you get one entry
4. press ALT+Down
5. press escape to dismiss the dialog
6. press cursor up.

Observer: the cursor now disappears. You need to click into the editor to get the cursor back.

data.title: Matched quote/paren/brace/bracket deletion
data.body:
I kind of expect if I delete the first character of the following pairs:

``` ts
""
''
{}
()
<>
```

It will delete the end character too. Given that the cursor is between the pairs and no characters are between the pairs.

data.title: [Node] Debugger is constructing invalid path when providing non-existing file or folder name in the launch.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains node project.
2. Configure node debugger for opened folder.
3. Open launch.json and set the program property with non-existing file or folder.
4. Debug the project and verify error message.
Actual: The path in the error message contains both backward slash and forward slash. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13836881/1b2e5444-ebc3-11e5-8ef2-35643dc45d69.png)
Expected: Debugger should construct the correct path for non-existing file as well.

data.title: [C#] Intellisense for the common operations are not user friendly (or irrelevant) and not displaying in correct order.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains C# files.
2. Open any .cs file and verify all the recommended extensions are installed to get intellisense.
3. Try to add some code for File IO operation without adding any namespace for IO operation. Like:
   public GlobalIntakeToolTokenCache(string userId)
         {
           File
         }
4. Use intellisens to fix error.
5. Verify all the available options and compare them with visual studio.
   ![visualstudio-vscode](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13836467/0c967b18-ebbf-11e5-9fca-c6269da3d9e5.png)

Actual:
1  The order of the suggestions in the list are not displaying according to user preference. In my case I am expecting It should ask for adding the namespace System.IO.
2.  When I selected second option form the list "Create field" then it is added a File variable and didn't fix the issue.
3. When I selected the forth option from the list "Create property" then it is added property but didn't fix the issue.
4. When I selected the fifth options "Declare local variable then it is creating a new variable with var keyword and considering my declare type as a class File. It looks like:   var file = File;

Expected: System should be smart enough to display the common actions first. Like in my case when I type a Keyword File then my intension is to use C# inbuilt APIs.

data.title: Conflicting default key binding
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Mac OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1.   Code > Preference > Keyboard Shortcut
2.  Search for  `"shift+alt+left"`  and `"shift+alt+right"`

You'll find two occurences of them:

```
{ "key": "shift+alt+left",        "command": "cursorWordLeftSelect",
                                     "when": "editorTextFocus" },
{ "key": "shift+alt+right",       "command": "cursorWordRightSelect",
                                     "when": "editorTextFocus" },
```

```
{ "key": "shift+alt+left",        "command": "workbench.files.action.openPreviousWorkingFile" },
{ "key": "shift+alt+right",       "command": "workbench.files.action.openNextWorkingFile" },
```

The latter group overrides the former.   However, IMHO, `cursorWordLeftSelect` is the right one because that's Mac's default behavior which works in every application.  It's kinda weird to declare specific shortcut that overrides OS-wide behavior.

data.title: Text selection bug in PowerShell editor for Edge browser
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Unknown (whatever is used by extensions in Azure Portal at https://portal.azure.com)
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise build 14257.rs1_release.160131-1800/

Originally reported by customers of Azure Automation extension of Azure Portal here: https://feedback.azure.com/forums/246290/suggestions/12296892

Steps to Reproduce (as stated by customers):

(User 1)
When editing a runbook and trying to select a single line of text, I cannot select all of the text and end of the selection jumps around. You can reproduce easily if the line is a comment and start with a # symbol.

(User 2)
Also: If the line does not have a space at the end, and the last character is part of a word (ie, not a paren/bracket), the cursor will have its position set to just after the first character of the word. 

For $variable, that means after '$' 
For $variable.property, that means after 'p'

TBH, I was almost convinced this was simply and issue in Edge causing problems, vs the editor. 
Because for instance, in many multi-line text editors (like this one), sometimes when trying to navigate up with the arrow key, it stops moving up at the beginning of a paragraph just after a line break that was created with **Enter** (as opposed to **Shift+Enter**, oddly enough).

data.title: Extension host crashes over night
data.body: - VSCode Version:0.10.11 - OS Version:Mac 10.11.3 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Left vscode over night 2. Code --> Preferences --> Color Theme This error does go away after restarting vscode once.

data.title: [Debugging] Error message should match with the configuration property to help user to understand problem better.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open a folder which contains file for node project.
2. Select the Node debugger so that it will generate launch.json with default setting.
3. Verify settings and update if needed.
4. Update path under program property and provide folder path instead of .js  file.
 like : "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app/",
5. Start debugging by pressing F5 or click on debug icon with launch option.
6. Verify error message.

Actual: It is displaying error message like:
Cannot launch program 'c:\src\AngularWithGrunt\app\'; enabling source maps might help.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/13832126/633bec9c-eb96-11e5-8f58-305a6e62f0ec.png)

Expected: The error message should match with the configuration property. At the first appearance it was clueless then after watching my launch.json file closely I found we have a config property like "sourceMaps" which was set to false. Correcting the error message will provide more usage to the  end user. 
Cannot launch program 'c:\src\AngularWithGrunt\app\'; enabling "sourceMaps" might help.

data.title: Syntax coloring in JSX changes when a destructured object preceding it in the same file is spread over more than one line.
[Node.js] Browser does not launch and missing set breakpoint
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
Following #3960 test tour
1. Create Azure Node.js Express (JavaScript) Project
2. Set a breakpoint in app.js at the line (or app.ts): 
`var app = express()`
Set a breakpoint in routes\index.js (or routes\index.ts) at the line that begins with: 
`res.render('index'`
3. F5 or start debugging

Actual:
1. Does not launch the browser
2. Second break point is not hit

data.title: #2500 and #2352 add focus indication to text editors / panels.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I added a `z-index` to this, otherwise the right part of the focus outline would not appear (it get's covered by some other elements).  I tested it, and it looks fine, but I wanted someone else to review just in case unexpected side-effects occur.
